title: Coherence vs ethics guard clarity
summary: Reaffirmed that coherence checks verify structural consistency while ethics gates prevent power being applied without provenance; our memory-state receipts guard is an ethics safeguard, not a coherence fix.
signals: Reviewer feedback questioned whether missing receipts break coherence or ethics, prompting a review of OCERS invariants and the memory guard's role.
actions: Document the distinction in upcoming governance notes and ensure future TMS/critic features escalate under ethics before automation.
notes: Receipt-free promotions remain logically coherent but ethically unsafe; maintain separate coherence and ethics checks when adding new automation loops.
